clusters.dossier: This briefing explores how Irish cultural identity is maintained and celebrated across the globe. We delve into the nuanced experiences of Irish emigrants, from the evolving perception of a 'neutral' Irish accent abroad to the global phenomenon of Irish pubs serving as vital community hubs and cultural touchstones for the diaspora. One Kerryman, for instance, has embarked on a quest to visit every Irish pub worldwide, highlighting their role as de facto ambassadors for Irishness, even finding a 'cottage inside a Jakarta shopping centre' operating as an Irish pub.

We hear from Irish individuals carving out unique lives abroad and embarking on personal journeys of self-discovery. This segment features an Irish winemaker in Catalonia, Tom Gallagher, who draws parallels between viticulture and his Roscommon farming roots, finding a different kind of 'milking' in the Spanish sun. Alongside this, we follow an emigrant's transformative year in Vancouver, highlighting themes of independence, resilience, and finding community and connection to home through storytelling events like Seanchoíche.

This briefing brings focus to two powerful eyewitness accounts of significant global challenges. An Irishman living in Australia shares his terrifying close encounter with the devastating 1994 bushfires, underscoring the growing threat of climate change and fire storms, describing the blackness and roaring cacophony. Separately, we hear a poignant reflection from an Irish individual who, as a 13-year-old boy in Paris, was caught in the midst of the 2015 Bataclan attacks, detailing the confusion and fear as the city turned threatening around him.
